legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: COVID-19 Infection Survey

title.text: Are you completing the questions on behalf of {first_name} ?

description: For example, you are a parent or carer completing the questions for a child.

question.title: There has been a problem accessing the survey

description.text:
This questionnaire is intended for {first_name}. You have indicated that you are not {first_name}or completing the questionnaire on behalf of them.

If this is correct, please:

1.Tick the continue box and then select “Save and continue”.

2.On the next page, select the “Submit” button to submit the questionnaire.

3.Call the helpline on 0xxxxxxxxxx. You will need your Participant ID. The survey team member on the phone will tell you what to do next.

If you are {first_name}, or completing the questions on behalf of them:

1.Select “< Previous” two times. You can find this at the top left-hand side of this page, underneath the blue banner that says “COVID-19 Infection Survey”.

2.You will then need to amend the answers to be able to complete the survey.

question.title: Looking at your email or letter with the dates for you to take part this time. Have you been asked to...

options.label: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
options.value: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample

options.label: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample
options.value: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample

contents.description: This section will ask about the swab and / or blood samples we have asked you to take in this testing window.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions 'you' refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Have you successfully taken your swab sample?
description:
If you are planning to take your sample but have not yet done so, please exit the questionnaire and return when you have taken it. This is because we will ask questions about your samples that help us to understand if you are eligible for a voucher.

If your swab test kit arrived damaged or with parts missing, select "No".

question.title: Why could you not successfully take your swab sample?

options.label: I tried but could not take it
options.value: I tried but could not take it

options.label: I did not want to take it this month
options.value: I did not want to take it this month

options.label: The swab test kit arrived damaged
options.value: The swab test kit arrived damaged

options.label: The swab test kit arrived with parts missing
options.value: The swab test kit arrived with parts missing

options.label: The swab test kit arrived both damaged and with parts missing
options.value: The swab test kit arrived both damaged and with parts missing

options.label: I am near the end of my testing window and my swab test kit has not arrived
options.value: I am near the end of my testing window and my swab test kit has not arrived

in: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample

title.text: Is this your swab sample barcode {swab_test_barcode} ?

description: This can be found on your swab sample pot and also at the top of the Important Information sheet that was included in your swab test kit. It is in the format SWT followed by 8 numbers.

question.title: Please enter the barcode of the swab sample kit you used.
description:
This can be found on your swab sample pot and also at the top of the Important Information sheet that was included in your swab test kit.

Please enter the 8 numbers that come after the letters SWT.

question.title: On which date did you take your swab sample?
What time did you take your swab sample?
description:
If you took your sample at midday this is 12pm. If you took you sample at midnight this is 12am.

Answer to the closest 15 minutes. For example, if you took your swab sample at 3:25pm, round this to 3:30pm.

question.title: Have you returned your swab sample?
description:
This means the sample has been posted in a priority post box or it has been collected by a courier.

Answer 'no' if you are planning to return your sample when you have completed this questionnaire.

question.title: On which date did you return your swab sample?
On which date will you return your swab sample?

in: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample

question.title: Have you successfully taken your blood sample?
description:
If you are planning to take your sample but have not yet done so, please exit the questionnaire and return when you have taken it. This is because we will ask questions about your samples that help us to understand if you are eligible for a voucher.

If your blood test kit arrived damaged or with parts missing, select "No".

question.title: Why could you not take your blood sample?

options.label: I tried but could not take it
options.value: I tried but could not take it

options.label: I decided not to take it this month
options.value: I decided not to take it this month

options.label: The blood test kit arrived damaged
options.value: The blood test kit arrived damaged

options.label: The blood test kit arrived with parts missing
options.value: The blood test kit arrived with parts missing

options.label: The blood test kit arrived both damaged and with parts missing
options.value: The blood test kit arrived both damaged and with parts missing

options.label: I am near the end of my testing window and my blood test kit has not arrived
options.value: I am near the end of my testing window and my blood test kit has not arrived

question.title: Why could you not take the blood sample?

options.label: I could not get enough blood into the pot
options.value: I could not get enough blood into the pot

options.label: There were issues with the kit
options.value: There were issues with the kit

in: I decided not to take it this month
The blood test kit arrived damaged
The blood test kit arrived with parts missing
The blood test kit arrived both damaged and with parts missing
I am near the end of my testing window and my blood test kit has not arrived

title.text: Is this your blood sample barcode {blood_test_barcode} ?

description: This can be found on your large sample carrier tube and also at the top of the Important Information sheet that was included in your blood test kit. It is in the format BLT followed by 8 numbers.

question.title: Please enter the barcode of the blood sample kit you used.
description:
This can be found on your large sample carrier tube and also at the top of the Important Information sheet that was included in your blood test kit.

Please enter the 8 numbers that come after the letters BLT.

question.title: On which date did you take your blood sample?
What time did you take your blood sample?
description:
If you took your sample at midday this is 12pm. If you took you sample at midnight this is 12am.

Answer to the closest 15 minutes. For example, if you took your swab sample at 3:25pm, round this to 3:30pm.

question.title: Have you returned your blood sample?
description:
This means the sample has been posted in a priority post box or it has been collected by a courier.

Answer 'no' if you are planning to return your sample when you have completed this questionnaire.

question.title: On which date did you return your blood sample?
On which date will you return your blood sample?

in: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample

question.title: Would you like to complete this questionnaire even though we cannot send you a voucher this time?
description:
Thank you for letting us know about your test kits. Unfortunately, due to the short timescale we have for each testing window, we cannot send replacement kits.

If you would like to complete the questionnaire, please do so because your data is still extremely valuable to us.

Unfortunately, we cannot send you a voucher this time because you must take a sample and complete the questionnaire to be eligible. We are sorry for any disappointment this may cause, and we will monitor the reasons for the damaged kits to prevent this happening in the future.

question.title: Thank you for letting us know about your test kit.
description:
We'll be in touch again about your next testing window.

You will be taken to the final page where you can finish this questionnaire and select "submit".

Please select continue to go to the next page.

contents.description: This section is about work and education.
We ask these questions to understand the risk of current and past respiratory infections depending on where you work or study.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions 'you' refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Are you aged 16 or over?
What is your current work, education or other status? That is where you spend most of your time, even if you are currently absent.
description: If for example, you are working and studying, please tell us where you spend most of your time.

options.label: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work
options.value: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work

in: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work

question.title: What best describes your current situation?

options.label: Currently working - this includes if you are on sick leave or other leave for less than 4 weeks
options.value: Currently working - this includes if you are on sick leave or other leave for less than 4 weeks

options.label: Currently not working due to sickness lasting 4 weeks or more
options.value: Currently not working due to sickness lasting 4 weeks or more

options.label: Currently not working for other reasons such as maternity or paternity lasting 4 weeks or more

description: Exclude any voluntary work you may do.

options.value: Looking for paid work and able to start

options.value: Not looking for paid work due to long-term sickness or disability

options.value: Not looking for paid work for reasons such as looking after the home or family or not wanting a job

options.value: A child aged 4 or over at home-school

options.value: Attending a college or other further education provider including apprenticeships

question.title: Has your main job or business changed since the last time you completed your questionnaire?

in: Currently working - this includes if you are on sick leave or other leave for less than 4 weeks
Currently not working due to sickness lasting 4 weeks or more
Currently not working for other reasons such as maternity or paternity lasting 4 weeks or more

question.title: What is the title of your main job or business now?
description:
For example, primary school teacher, car mechanic, district nurse, structural engineer.

Do not include the name or location of your company.

question.title: What do you mainly do in your main job or business now?
description: Please describe as fully as possible. For example, please say if you have any management responsibilities or if you require special qualifications or training to do this job.

question.title: Which employment sector do you work in now?
description:
For example, a cleaner working in a school should select 'Teaching and Education' but 'Healthcare' if working in a hospital.

Police Officers and Fire Fighters should select 'Civil Service or Local Government'.

options.label: Transport. This includes storage and logistics

If currently unwell, choose what you would usually do when not unwell.

Choose 0 if home-schooled.

contents.description: This section asks about how your health has been recently.  This provides important information that helps inform policies to protect the country.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions 'you' refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Have you had any of the following symptoms in the last 7 days?
description: You will be asked about other symptoms on the next page.

contents.description: Include all the symptoms you have experienced:

list: regardless of the cause
even if you experience them regularly as part of a long-term health condition

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

question.title: Have you had any of these other symptoms in the last 7 days?

contents.description: Include all the symptoms you have experienced:

list: regardless of the cause
even if you experience them regularly as part of a long-term health condition

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

question.title: Which of these symptoms are new or worse than usual for you?

contents.description: Exclude:

list: symptoms experienced regularly as part of a long-term health condition that have not been worse than usual

question.title: And which of these symptoms are new or worse than usual for you?

contents.description: Exclude:

list: symptoms experienced regularly as part of a long-term health condition that have not been worse than usual

question.title: What was the earliest date that any of these symptoms became worse than usual for you, or first started if they are new?
description:
Enter the earliest date, including if this was more than 7 days ago.

If you can't remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you can't make a best guess, put the 15th.

contents.description: Exclude:

list: symptoms experienced regularly as part of a long-term health condition that have not been worse than usual

question.title: Do you have long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses lasting or expected to last 12 months or more?
description: Please do not include Long COVID symptoms (we ask about these later) but include things like diabetes, heart disease, asthma, and depression.

question.title: Do any of these conditions or illnesses reduce your ability to carry-out day-to-day activities?
description: Please don't include any effects of Long COVID alone, we ask about this later.

question.title: Have you ever smoked cigarettes regularly?
Do you currently smoke or vape at all?
Which of the following do you currently smoke or vape?
Have you been vaccinated against COVID-19 since the last time you completed this questionnaire?
description: Answer 'Yes' if you have received a first, second, or later dose, or a booster dose, since you last completed this questionnaire

question.title: What was the type of the most recent COVID-19 vaccination you have had?
description: Answer for the type of your most recent dose or booster dose.

options.label: I do not know the type
options.value: I do not know the type

question.title: How many doses of any COVID-19 vaccine have you received so far?
description: Include all COVID-19 vaccines, including those received as part of a trial, booster doses and any additional doses received due to being immunosuppressed.

question.title: What was the date of your most recent COVID-19 vaccination?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, put the 15th.

question.title: Have you been vaccinated against flu since you last completed this questionnaire?
description: This is commonly known as the ‘flu jab’ or ‘seasonal flu vaccination’.

question.title: What was the date of your most recent flu vaccination?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, put the 15th.

question.title: Have you been outside of the UK since you last completed this questionnaire?
What was the last country you visited?
description: Do not include airport layovers.

question.title: On what date did you last return to the UK?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you can't make a best guess, put the 15th.

in: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample

contents.description: The next section is about any experience you have had of any respiratory infections including coronavirus (COVID-19). This helps us to understand how these viruses are affecting society.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions 'you' refers to {first_name}.

question.title: In the last 28 days, do you know or think that you have had a respiratory infection or illness?
description:
Respiratory infections or illnesses involve parts of the body involved in breathing, such as the sinuses / nose, throat, airways or lungs.

These include colds and infections such as flu, COVID-19 and chest infections. These can cause symptoms like a cough, sore throat, stuffy or runny nose, high temperature (fever), tiredness, changes to sense of taste or smell, muscle aches or shortness of breath.

Exclude pre-existing conditions, for example asthma.

We will use the term respiratory infection or illness throughout this questionnaire.

question.title: In the last 28 days, what type of respiratory infection or illness do you know or think you have had?
description: If you have not done a test, select the type you think you had.

question.title: When did this most recent COVID-19 infection start?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you can't make a best guess, put the 15th.

question.title: Did you have any of the following symptoms as part of your most recent COVID-19 infection?
description:
Select the symptoms you thought were caused or made worse by the COVID-19 infection you had.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the next page.

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

question.title: Did you have any of these symptoms as part of your most recent COVID-19 infection?
description: Select the symptoms you thought were caused or made worse by the COVID-19 infection you had.

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

question.title: When did this most recent flu infection start?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you can't make a best guess, put the 15th.

question.title: Did you have any of the following symptoms as part of your most recent flu infection?
description:
Select the symptoms you thought were caused or made worse by the flu infection you had.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the next page.

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

question.title: Did you have any of these symptoms as part of your most recent flu infection?
description: Select the symptoms you thought were caused or made worse by the flu infection you had.

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

question.title: When did this most recent respiratory infection or illness start?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you can't make a best guess, put the 15th.

question.title: Did you have any of the following symptoms as part of your most recent respiratory infection or illness?
description:
Select the symptoms you thought were caused or made worse by the respiratory infection or illness you had.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the next page.

definitions.title: What is a respiratory infection or illness?

contents.description: Respiratory infections or illnesses involve parts of the body involved in breathing, such as the sinuses / nose, throat, airways or lungs.

These include colds and infections such as flu, COVID-19 and chest infections. These can cause symptoms like a cough, sore throat, stuffy or runny nose, high temperature (fever), tiredness, changes to sense of taste or smell, muscle aches or shortness of breath.
Exclude pre-existing conditions, for example asthma.

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

question.title: Did you have any of these symptoms as part of your most recent respiratory infection or illness?
description: Select the symptoms you thought were caused or made worse by the respiratory infection or illness you had.

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

question.title: Have you had a swab test for COVID-19 infection since you last completed this questionnaire?
description:
Exclude any tests done as part of this survey.

Include any type of swab test for COVID-19 infection, such as a lateral flow or a PCR test.

question.title: What were the results of all the swab tests you've had since you last completed this questionnaire?
description: Please choose the first option that applies.

options.label: One or more tests were positive
options.value: One or more tests were positive

options.label: One or more tests were negative and none were positive
options.value: One or more tests were negative and none were positive

question.title: What was the date of the first positive swab test you had since you last completed this questionnaire?
description: If you can't remember the day of the month, make your best guess. If you can't make a best guess, put the 15th.

in: One or more tests were negative and none were positive

question.title: What type of test was the first positive swab test you had since you last completed this questionnaire?

options.label: A lateral flow test. That is the test you can do yourself and you do not have to send it to a laboratory because the result shows in the device in about 30 minutes
options.value: A lateral flow test. That is the test you can do yourself and you do not have to send it to a laboratory because the result shows in the device in about 30 minutes

options.label: A PCR test. That is the test that is sent off to a laboratory
options.value: A PCR test. That is the test that is sent off to a laboratory

in: One or more tests were negative and none were positive

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many days have you not been able to do usual daily activities for any personal health reasons?
description:
Include the days where you were not able to do something you would usually do because of your health on that day. This could be for any health reason.

For example, usual daily activities may be: housework, errands, going to work or school, going to clubs or classes.

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you were unable to do usual daily activities, how many days were due to respiratory infections?

description: For example, usual daily activities may be: housework, errands, going to work or school, going to clubs or classes.

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many days have you spent off work or education for any personal health reasons?
description: If you included a day in an earlier question, you can include it again here.

in: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work
A child below school age and not attending a nursery or pre-school or childminder

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you spent off work or education, how many days were due to respiratory infections?

description: If you included a day in an earlier question, you can include it again here.

question.title: In the last 28 days, on how many days did you have an appointment at a GP surgery for any personal health reasons?

contents.description: Include:

list: in person, telephone, and online appointments
appointments with all GP healthcare staff, for example doctors and nurses
pre-booked appointments and drop in visits

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you had an appointment at a GP surgery, how many days were due to respiratory infections?

contents.description: Include:

list: in person, telephone, and online appointments
appointments with all GP healthcare staff, for example doctors and nurses
pre-booked appointments and drop in visits.

question.title: In the last 28 days, on how many days have you spoken to a pharmacist or called 111 for advice about any personal health reasons?
description:
For example, if you called multiple times on one day, this would be 1.

Exclude contact about a repeat prescription.

title.text: Out of the {number_of_days} days you spoke to a pharmacist or called 111, how many days were due to respiratory infections?

description:
For example, if you called multiple times on one day, this would be 1.

Exclude contact about a repeat prescription.

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many times have you attended urgent care for any personal health reasons?
description:
For example, A&E (accident and emergency), out of hours clinics, minor injuries, walk-in centres or urgent call outs.

Exclude hospital admissions or appointments.

title.text: Out of the {number_of_times} times you attended urgent care, how many times were due to respiratory infections?

description:
For example, A&E (accident and emergency), out of hours clinics, minor injuries, walk-in centres or urgent call outs.

Exclude hospital admissions or appointments.

question.title: In the last 28 days, how many times have you been admitted to hospital?

contents.description: Include:

list: if you were admitted to hospital pre-planned or as an emergency
if you were admitted to hospital after attending A&E (accident and emergency)

contents.description: Exclude:

list: if you attended A&E (accident and emergency) and were then referred somewhere else or discharged
hospital appointments where you are not admitted to hospital

title.text: Out of the {number_of_times} times you have been admitted to hospital, how many times were due to respiratory infections?

contents.description: Include:

list: if you were admitted to hospital pre-planned or as an emergency
if you were admitted to hospital after attending A&E (accident and emergency)

contents.description: Exclude:

list: if you attended A&E (accident and emergency) and were then referred somewhere else or discharged
hospital appointments where you are not admitted to hospital

question.title: Would you describe yourself as currently having long COVID?
description: Long COVID can be described as still experiencing symptoms more than 4 weeks after you first had COVID-19, that are not explained by something else.

question.title: Does this reduce your ability to carry out day-to-day activities compared with the time before you had COVID-19?
Do you have any of the following symptoms as part of your experience of long COVID?
description:
Please include any pre-existing symptoms which long COVID has made worse, but exclude any pre-existing symptoms that have not changed due to long COVID.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the following pages.

options.label: Problems with eyesight or sore eyes
options.value: Problems with eyesight or sore eyes

options.label: Palpitations or heart rate pounding or beating irregularly
options.value: Palpitations or heart rate pounding or beating irregularly

question.title: And do you have any of these symptoms as part of your experience of long COVID?
description:
Please include any pre-existing symptoms which long COVID has made worse, but exclude any pre-existing symptoms that have not changed due to long COVID.

You will be asked about other symptoms on the following page.

options.label: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual
options.value: Loss of appetite or eating less than usual

question.title: And do you have any of these symptoms as part of your experience of long COVID?
description: Please include any pre-existing symptoms which long COVID has made worse, but exclude any pre-existing symptoms that have not changed due to long COVID.

options.label: Low mood or not enjoying anything
options.value: Low mood or not enjoying anything

question.title: Do your symptoms tend to get worse after mental and / or physical effort?
description:
For example, completing a crossword, doing tasks on a computer, going for a walk or doing housework.

This includes if your symptoms get worse more so than you'd usually expect based on the activity you are doing. The worsening could start hours or days after you undertook the activity.

in: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample

contents.description: This section asks about your contact with other people.
We ask these questions to understand how contact with others across different settings affects the risk of current and past respiratory infections.

description.text: Remember, in the following questions 'you' refers to {first_name}.

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you been inside a hospital for any reason?
description: For example, for work, for a consultation or treatment, to visit someone, to take someone else.

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you been inside a hospice, care home or residential home for any reason?
description: For example, for work, to visit someone, or to take someone else.

question.title: Do you generally wear any kind of face covering or mask when you are in enclosed public spaces, such as shops, or using public transport?
description:
If you are currently unwell, choose what you would usually do when you are well.

Exclude places where masks are required, such as hospitals.

options.label: I do not go to enclosed public spaces or use public transport
options.value: I do not go to enclosed public spaces or use public transport

options.label: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons
options.value: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many children and young people under 18 years old, who do not live in your home, have you had physical contact with?
description: For example, a handshake, hug, personal care or any social contact with physical touching.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many adults aged 18 to 69, who do not live in your home, have you had physical contact with?
description: For example, a handshake, hug, personal care or any social contact with physical touching.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many older adults aged 70 years old and over, who do not live in your home, have you had physical contact with?
description: For example, a handshake, hug, personal care or any social contact with physical touching.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many children and young people under 18 years old, who do not live in your home, have you had direct but non-physical contact with in person?
description: For example, meeting a friend and going for coffee or a meal together.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many adults aged 18 to 69, who do not live in your home, have you had direct but non-physical contact with in person?
description: For example, meeting a friend and going for coffee or a meal together.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many older adults aged 70 years old and over, who do not live in your home, have you had direct but non-physical contact with in person?
description: For example, meeting a friend and going for coffee or a meal together.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times have you spent one hour or longer inside another person's home?
description:
This does not include their garden or doorstep.

For example, if you spent one hour or longer inside another person's home one day, and the next day you spent one hour or longer inside two different homes, you would select 3 times.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times has someone who doesn't live with you spent one hour or longer inside your home?
description:
This does not include your garden or doorstep.

For example, if two people spent one hour or longer in your home on one day, and three people spent one hour or longer in your home another day, you would select 2 times.

question.title: In the last 7 days, how many times have you been outside of your home for shopping?
In the last 7 days, how many times have you been outside of your home to socialise? Exclude going into other people's homes
description: For example, going into restaurants or going to the cinema.

question.title: In the last 28 days, on how many days have you taken part in high intensity indoor sports or exercise, near other people?
description: Only include where you are breathing heavily close to other people and the risk of spreading infections is high.

question.title: In the last 28 days have you attended any large events with over 1,000 people?
description: If you are not sure how many other people were there, make your best guess.

contents.description: Include:

list: indoor and outdoor events. For example, sports events, festivals or concerts

contents.description: Exclude:

list: events with 1,000 people or less, as you will be asked about these next

question.title: In the last 28 days have you attended any events with 100 to 1,000 people?
description: If you are not sure how many other people were there, make your best guess.

contents.description: Include:

list: indoor and outdoor events. For example, concerts, weddings, sports events, or conferences

contents.description: Exclude:

list: activities that are not events, such as going to the cinema, to restaurants or shopping

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you used any transport where you have shared with people outside of your home? Exclude travel to your place of work or education.
description: For example, to the shops, to a restaurant, to see family or to go to an appointment.

options.label: Underground or metro or light rail or tram
options.value: Underground or metro or light rail or tram

options.label: I have not used transport shared with people outside of my home for reasons other than travel to work or education
options.value: I have not used transport shared with people outside of my home for reasons other than travel to work or education

question.title: Do you generally wear any kind of face covering or mask when you are at work or your place of education, because of respiratory infections?
description: If you are currently unwell, choose what you would usually do when you are well.

options.label: I am not going to my place of work or education
options.value: I am not going to my place of work or education

options.label: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons
options.value: I cover my face for other reasons - for example for religious or cultural reasons

question.title: Thank you, please continue to the next page to submit your questionnaire
description:
This is the end of your questionnaire. Thank you very much for taking part.

Please remember to return your samples today, if you haven't already done so.

https://www.royalmail.com/services-near-you#/

If returning your samples to a priority postbox, you might want to make a record of where and when you posted the samples, in case they get lost in the post. For example, taking a photo of the postbox or writing this down.

The vouchers you receive for taking part are not always sent immediately after each round of tests. This means that you might receive a voucher covering the amounts for more than one round of tests. Also, you and members of your household may not all receive vouchers at the same time

in: Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample
Do this questionnaire and take a swab sample and a blood sample

description: This is the end of your questionnaire. Thank you very much for taking part.

contents.description: Your views are essential to us
As you are one of the first participants to continue taking part in the COVID-19 Infection Survey after the recent changes, finding out what you think is extremely important to us.
We are offering you the chance to give some short feedback about your experience.
Questions can be answered online or over the telephone. You do not have to give feedback, it is completely up to you.
The feedback survey can be completed online through the following link https://studies.ons.gov.uk/s/feedback7/
Alternatively, if you would like to complete this feedback survey over the phone, please email COVID19.RAD@ons.gov.uk or call 0300 067 2138 to arrange this.
If another household member wants to start their questionnaire using the same device
You will need to click the "leave this page" link below.
They will then need to log in using their unique 16 character access code in the email or letter they were sent.

submission.title: Submit your questionnaire
submission.warning: You cannot view your answers after submission
